page.title: 08Housing
page.content: In our survey area there are several scattered farmhouses but only one real area of much housing. That is the village of White Notley. The houses as they stand now are not very old; in Vicararge Avenue the Council Houses were built in about 1950 but were not intended to be in use for as long as they have been. Some people have bought their Council House and many of the others have recently had their original windows replaced with new ones which have hard wood frames. There are some newer brick built houses built in the 1960s and early 1970s in The Street and these are nearly all privately owned. There is a group of houses around the pub and the shop which are older. This is at the middle of the village where two roads meet.
